StudyInfo.StudyNameEntrez: Pain and Morphine Pharmacogenomics in Children

Policy.acknowledgement_statement: The dataset used for the analyses described in this manuscript was obtained from the database of Genotype and Phenotype (dbGaP) found at http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/gap [accession number phs xxxxxx]. The dataset, entitled "Pain and Morphine Pharmacogenomics in Children" was provided by Vidya Chidambaran, M.D. Data collection and submission was facilitated through research supported by K23 HD082782 through the Eunice Kennedy Shriver National Institute of Child Health and Human Development (NICHD), NIH (PI: Chidambaran); NCATS, NIH, through Grant UL1 TR000077; through the T1 Junior Faculty Award and Clinical Research Feasibility Funds; APSF/ASA Safety Scientist Career Development Award; and the Center for Pediatric Genomics Grant (CCHMC).
Policy.ic_specific_access_term:
The use of the “Pain and Morphine Pharmacogenomics in Children” dataset requires local IRB approval. All requestors and data users must provide a local Institutional Review Board (IRB) letter from their respective institution approving conduct of the proposed research project. Only full or expedited approvals will be accepted.
The annual progress report should cite work done that relates specifically to the “Pain and Morphine Pharmacogenomics in Children” dataset and not just a generic report for a series of datasets that may also have been requested at the same time.

GSR_Access.gsr_mode_label: Unrestricted access (institution did not respond within six months)

ConsentGroup.title: Health/Medical/Biomedical (IRB)
ConsentGroup.name: HMB-IRB
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction: Use of this data is limited to health/medical/biomedical purposes, does not include the study of population origins or ancestry. Requestor must provide documentation of local IRB approval.
